reasoning: Autoimmune Addison's disease incidence estimated at 0.8-1.6 per 100k person-years; using midpoint of 1.2. This represents new diagnoses of primary adrenal insufficiency due to autoimmune destruction of the adrenal cortex.
source: Erichsen MM et al. (2009). Epidemiology, clinical features and serum biomarkers in autoimmune primary adrenal insufficiency: a nation-wide study. J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 94(12):4882-4890
